title: 13 of the Childcare Support Act 2018 (No. 11 of 2018), and with the consent of
heading: 5. Schedule 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution
text_raw:
5. Schedule 3 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the substitution 

of the following schedule for schedule 3. 

‚ÄúSCHEDULE 1 

Amounts per hour of non-income related financial support 

Non-income related financial support shall be calculated at the following rate: 

‚Ç¨2.14 per hour in the case of a child who is older than 24 weeks of age and under 
15 years of age.‚Äù 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigi√∫il" of 20th August, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 ‚ÄúSCHEDULE 3 

Methodology in accordance with which the amount per hour (if any) of 
income-related financial support shall be calculated 

[410] 3 

(a) The base income threshold shall be ‚Ç¨26,000. 

(b) A minimum amount of income-related financial support at the 
rate of ‚Ç¨2.14 applies to a child aged between 24 weeks and under 
15 years of age. 

(c) 

If an applicant qualifies for income-related financial support, the 
scheme administrator shall determine the amount per hour of 
income-related financial support as follows: 

(i) where an applicant‚Äôs reckonable income is below or equal 
to the base income threshold, the maximum amount per 
hour will apply; 

(ii) where an applicant‚Äôs reckonable income is at or exceeds the 

income limit, the amount per hour shall be zero; 

(iii) where an applicant‚Äôs reckonable income is between the base 
income threshold and the income limit, the amount per hour 
shall be determined by the following formula: 

ùëÖùëéùë°ùëí ùëùùëíùëü ‚Ñéùëúùë¢ùëü = ùëÅùëÜ + (

(ùëãùëÜ ‚àí ùëÅùëÜ)(ùëÄùëá ‚àí ùëÖùêº))
(ùëÄùëá ‚àí ùêµùëá)

) 

where‚Äì 

NS is the minimum amount of financial support per 
hour, 

XS is the maximum amount of financial support per 
hour, 

MT is the income limit, 

BT is the base income threshold, and 

RI is the reckonable income. 

(d) 

In determining the amount per hour, if any, of income-related 
financial support, a Multiple Child Discount shall be applied to 
net income by the scheme administrator in relation to children 
under the age of 15 years - 

(1) who reside with the applicant or with his or her partner, and 

(2) where the applicant or his or her partner is a parent of the 

child. 

The discount which shall be applied to net income to 
determine the amount per hour of income related financial 
support shall be: 

(i) 

‚Ç¨4,300 in relation to two children; 

(ii) ‚Ç¨8,600 in relation to more than two children.‚Äù 

 
 
 4 [410] 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 August, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

8 August, 2024. 

RODERIC O'GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth.

title: 13 of the Childcare Support Act 2018 (No. 11 of 2018), and with the consent of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are made pursuant to powers conferred on the Minister for 
Children and Youth Affairs under section 13 of the Childcare Support Act 2018 
with the consent of the Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

These Regulations amend the Regulations previously made under section 13 of 
the Childcare Support Act 2018 (S.I. 378/2019), (S.I. No. 367/2022) and (S.I. 
No. 701/2022) to increase the hourly minimum award from ‚Ç¨1.40 to ‚Ç¨2.14
